name: rnaseq-test
title: RNA-seq Gene Expression Analysis
description: Comprehensive RNA-seq analysis pipeline for gene expression quantification and differential analysis. Supports multiple aligners and quantification methods for accurate transcript abundance estimation. Ideal for transcriptomics studies in model organisms and clinical research.
content:
ðŸ§¬ Overview

The RNA-seq Gene Expression Analysis pipeline enables comprehensive transcriptome profiling from RNA sequencing data. This workflow quantifies gene and transcript expression levels, identifies differentially expressed genes, and provides detailed quality control metrics for biological insights.

ðŸ”§ Main Capabilities

This pipeline integrates state-of-the-art tools for RNA-seq analysis:

  • Quality Control: FastQC for read quality, Trim Galore for adapter removal
  • Alignment: STAR (splice-aware) or HISAT2 for accurate read mapping
  • Quantification: Salmon/RSEM for transcript abundance, featureCounts for gene counts
  • Strandedness Detection: Automatic library type inference
  • Quality Metrics: RSeQC, Qualimap, dupRadar for RNA-specific QC
  • Visualization: MultiQC comprehensive report with all metrics

ðŸ“‹ Input Parameters

Samplesheet Format: Provide a CSV file with sample information following this structure:

sample,fastq_1,fastq_2,strandedness
control_1,/path/to/control_1_R1.fastq.gz,/path/to/control_1_R2.fastq.gz,auto
control_2,/path/to/control_2_R1.fastq.gz,/path/to/control_2_R2.fastq.gz,auto
treatment_1,/path/to/treatment_1_R1.fastq.gz,/path/to/treatment_1_R2.fastq.gz,auto
treatment_2,/path/to/treatment_2_R1.fastq.gz,/path/to/treatment_2_R2.fastq.gz,auto
  • sample: Unique sample identifier
  • fastq_1/2: Paths to paired-end FASTQ files (or single-end for fastq_1 only)
  • strandedness: Library type (auto, forward, reverse, unstranded)

ðŸ’¡ Resource Optimization: For optimal resource consumption, the number of nodes should not be greater than the number of samples in your samplesheet.

ðŸ”¬ Scientific Relevance & Use Cases

This pipeline is essential for:

  • Differential Expression: Identifying genes responding to treatments or conditions
  • Functional Genomics: Understanding gene function and regulation
  • Biomarker Discovery: Finding diagnostic or prognostic markers
  • Drug Development: Assessing therapeutic responses at molecular level

The pipeline provides both gene-level and transcript-level quantification, enabling comprehensive transcriptome characterization for downstream analyses like pathway enrichment and network inference.

ðŸ“Š Expected Outputs

  • Gene Expression Matrix: Count tables ready for differential expression analysis
  • Transcript Quantification: TPM/FPKM values for abundance estimates
  • Quality Reports: MultiQC report with alignment stats, gene coverage, and more
  • BigWig Files: Genome browser tracks for visualization
  • Aligned BAMs: Sorted and indexed alignments for further analysis

Built with Nextflow and the nf-core/rnaseq pipeline v3.19.0
